arts.ttl: Champions League | Slovan Bratislava 2-3 Milan: Match Report
arts.sum: AC Milan secured a crucial 3-2 victory against Slovan Bratislava in the Champions League, but it was far from a walk in the park. The win takes coach Paulo Fonseca’s side to nine points in the group stage standings, solidifying their chances of progressing to the knockout rounds. Goals from Pulisic, substitute Rafael Leão, and Abraham sealed the deal for the Rossoneri, although a late stunner by 18-year-old Nino Marcelli, a Slovakian with Italian roots, added drama to the closing moments. arts.ttl: AC Milan and Atletico Madrid each win to near automatic qualifying spots in Champions League
arts.sum: AC Milan followed up its win at Real Madrid with a 3-2 victory at last-place Slovan Bratislava in the Champions League on Tuesday. Atletico beat Paris Saint-Germain in the previous round and extended its winning streak across all competitions to six matches.

arts.ttl: Christian Pulisic scores again for AC Milan: who are the top American scorers in the Champions League?
arts.sum: There’s no stopping Christian Pulisic, who scored once again for AC Milan in their Champions League game away to Slovan Bratislava on Tuesday. Former PSV Eindhoven and Rangers winger DaMarcus Beasley is next on four, with ex-Borussia Mönchenglabach full-back Fabian Johnson, Jermaine Jones, formerly of Schalke and current Union Berlin striker Jordan Pefok, while playing for Swiss side Young Boys, the other players with multiple Champions League goals (all two).

arts.ttl: Abraham on Milan, Mourinho and Chelsea memories
arts.sum: BBC Sport's Nedum Onuoha travels to Italy to sample a classic Milanese dinner with AC Milan striker Tammy Abraham while catching up on what life has been like for the forward playing in Italy since his move from Chelsea.
